text: hena nitāi vine bhāi    rādhā-kṛṣṇa pāite nāi
translation: Cooling like ten million moons, Nitāi’s lotus feet soothe the world with their shade. O brother! Without Nitāi, you cannot reach Rādhā-Kṛṣṇa. Firmly grasp Nitāi’s feet.

text: se sambandha nāhi yāra    vṛthā janma gela tāra
nitāi nā balila mukhe    majila saṁsāra-sukhe
translation: The life of one who had no connection with Nitāi passed in vain. Such an animal is very wicked. What will learning (aristocratic birth) do for one who was immersed in worldly pleasures and never called aloud, ‘Nitāi’?

text: nitāiyer karuṇā habe    vraje rādhā-kṛṣṇa pābe
translation: Maddened with pride, forgetting Nitāi’s feet, I accept untruth as truth. When Nitāi bestows His mercy you will reach Rādhā-Kṛṣṇa in Vraja. Grasp Nitāi’s feet!

text: nitāiyer charaṇa satya    tā̐hāra sevaka nitya
narottama baḍa duḥkhī    nitāi more kara sukhī
translation: Nitāi’s feet are truth, and His servants are eternal. Always aspire for Nitāi’s feet. Narottam is very sad: “O Nitāi! Make me happy. Keep me beside your reddish feet.”
